page.title: 07LIVING IN GULVAL
page.content:
People find Gulval a pleasant place to live and many take an active part in village life. The surrounding countryside is attractive and the town of Penzance and the sea are both nearby. Even by Cornish standards the climate is mild.
Summer visitors bring increased traffic. People must cross the busy main road to reach the sea. The beaches, safer than many in Penwith, can be spoilt with litter. Any broken glass is a hazard for paddling children. Depending on winds and tides, there is an occasional problem with sewage from the Penzance outfall.
Cutbacks in local bus services are a current concern in the village, but in general people consider themselves very fortunate to live here.
